title: Create a manual reservation
content:
You may need to create a manual reservation for a request if automatic reservation fails. For example, this may be because there are no assets of the appropriate model available in stock.

You can create a manual reservation with the following methods.

When manually reserving assets, pay attention to the quantity of consumable assets. Manually split the assets as needed.

Method 1: create a manual reservation through Reservation

To create a manual reservation through Reservation: 

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.
  2. From SACM Home, select Reservations.

  3. Click  New.

  4. In the New Reservation dialog box, provide all requested information.

    new reservation
    Field Description
    Display label A display label for the reservation.
    Start date The date and time when the reservation is to start.
    End date The date and time when the reservation is to end.
    Reserved for The user that the assets are reserved for.
    Reserved device The device that is to be reserved.
    Reserved Infrastructure & peripheral assets The infrastructure & peripheral that is to be reserved.
    Reserved enterprise asset The enterprise asset that is to be reserved.

  5. Click Save. Service Management returns to the reservation record list and a new record is now added. The next step is to edit that record to add more information.

Method 2: create a manual reservation through Service Request

The following is an example of how to create a manual reservation. To do the procedure, there must be a pre-existing request created with (DEMO) Request a new PC as the selected offering.

  1. From the main menu, select Run > Service Request > Requests.

  2. Select the request, and click Details. The request record is displayed.

  3. Click the Reservation tab. The Reserve assets section is empty.

  4. Click Add. The Reserve Asset dialog box is displayed.

    With the displayed information, whoever is responsible for completing the manual reservation can reserve the asset according to whatever the stockroom policy is. For example, to reserve the asset with the nearest warranty end date, or with a first in first out policy based on the stockroom entry date.

    Add is disabled if any of the following are true:

    • The request is in the Done metaphase.

    • Requested asset model is empty.

    • The process type of the Requested asset model is Stationary.

    • There is an active reservation record for the request.

  5. Select one of the laptop records which is displayed, and click Reserve. The selected device is displayed in the Reserve assets section.

    To enable manual reservation a location should be defined on either the Request.RegisteredForLocation field or the Request.RequestedForPerson.Location field.

  6. From the main menu, select Tasks. Complete the remaining tasks:

    1. Select the Prepare PC task.

    2. Click Completed, then Save.

      The next stage is the task "Close reservation." This task is automatically completed.

      The next stage is to complete the manual task "Deliver PC."

    3. Select the Deliver PC task.

    4. Click Completed, then Save.
